privacyLaws.description: The TIPA was signed into law in May 2023, giving businesses just over two years to prepare for the new privacy bill. The Tennessee privacy law takes effect July 1, 2025.

personalDataCategories: Personal information collected from a known child

individualRights.name: Right to Know if a controller is processing the consumer’s personal information
Right to Opt Out of targeted advertising, sale of personal data, profiling, automated decision making
Right to Opt-in for processing of sensitive data

notice.description: A controller is required to provide a privacy notice that is easily accessible, clear, and meaningful to consumers. This notice should include: (1) the types of personal information that the controller processes, (2) the reasons for processing this personal information, (3) instructions on how consumers can exercise their rights under the law, including the process for appealing a decision made by the controller, (4) details about any categories of personal information that the controller sells to third parties, and (5) information about the categories of third parties to whom the controller sells personal information. This comprehensive notice aims to inform consumers about how their personal information is handled and shared by the controller.

purposeLimitation.description: Must not process personal data for purposes beyond what is reasonably necessary to achieve the objectives for the processing, as disclosed to the consumer, unless you obtain consumer consent.

securityReqs.description: A controller shall establish, implement, and maintain reasonable administrative, technical, and physical data security practices, as described in§ 47-18-3213, to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and accessibility of personal information. The data security practices must be appropriate to the volume and nature of the personal information at issue

processorReqs.description: Processors must follow the instructions of the controller and aid them in meeting their duties under the law. This assistance includes implementing appropriate technical and organizational measures to help the controller respond to consumer rights requests effectively and providing necessary information for data protection assessments. Additionally, contracts between controllers and processors must specify data processing procedures, including instructions for processing data, the duration, and the rights and obligations of both parties. Processors must ensure confidentiality, delete or return personal information as directed by the controller, and cooperate with assessments.

riskImpact.description: Controllers must conduct and properly document data protection assessments for specific processing activities involving personal information.

dataTransfer.description: The sale of personal information excludes the disclosure or transfer of personal information as part of specific business transactions like mergers, acquisitions, or bankruptcies where control of the controller's assets is assumed by a third party.

exemptions.description: Political subdivisions of the state, as well as bodies, authorities, boards, bureaus, commissions, districts, or other agencies of the state
Financial institution or an affiliate of a financial institution governed by, or personal data collected, processed, sold, or disclosed in accordance with the GLBA
Covered entity or business associate as defined in the privacy regulations of HIPAA
Institutions of higher education are exempted
Patient identifying information for purposes of 42 U.S.C. § 290dd-2

preemption: This act supersedes and preempts any conflicting provisions of any public or private act and laws, ordinances, resolutions, regulations, or the equivalent adopted by a home rule municipality, county, including a metropolitan government, or city regarding the processing of personal data by controllers or processors

penalties: A court may impose a civil penalty of up to seven thousand five hundred dollars ($7,500) for each violation of this part. If the court finds the controller or processor willfully or knowingly violated this part, then the court may, in its discretion, award treble damages
privateRightOfAction: If a business violates the TIPA, customers are not permitted to file a class action lawsuit or take a private right of action against it.

threshold.description: Exceed $25,000,000 in revenue AND must satisfies at least one of the other thresholds
Control or process personal information of at least 25,000 consumers and derive more than 50% of gross revenue from the sale of personal information
Control or process personal information of at least 175,000 consumers

otherPrivacyLaws.lawName: TN Code § 47-18-2107, Release of Personal Consumer Information
otherPrivacyLaws.description: Outlines regulations regarding the release of personal consumer information, particularly in the event of a breach of system security.

The Genetic Information Privacy Act aims to establish robust privacy safeguards to ensure that consumers' genetic information is handled responsibly and ethically by direct-to-consumer genetic testing companies operating in Tennessee.
